Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving.

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

Categories are undergoing changes; but they were planned long before others suggested them. I don't know if offensive will last because it is subjective. I know artikekt is working on the ability for guilds to choose multiple categories.

There's no secret Discord that ark and cap participate in. I was part of the RCP discord to see what they were up to and chat with other users on Discord that I like; the drama is blown out of proportions.

Other questions, comments, concerns?

parent.body: The admins were users of the_Donald on reddit (me too) and around the time of it getting quarantined and banned on reddit, they hung out in the dev lair of t_d discord developing not just a place for the_donald, but other topic communities. And they did it. Thus Ruqqus was born. And I hopped on board to invest time in building communities here, mostly with news and politics about Trump. I didn’t go to TD.win because I didn’t trust those mods, so I came to this frontier instead. And I liked the idea of being able to talk about things besides Trump.

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent.

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving.

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +ProLife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

post.body:
Knowing your enemy is necessary to fight them effectively.

About ten years ago on reddit a subreddit called ShitRedditSays was created by SomethingAweful users. Its stated goal was to stomp out misogyny and other badthink on reddit. 

Back then reddit was a pretty nice place. Those were the days of Ron Paul and the place was full of techies and libertarians. You could speak your mind in larger subreddits without being instantly banned. Free speech was still something that was universally valued.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within. 

Their tactics included:

 - Coordination outside of reddit
 - Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
 - Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
 - Attacking fringe communities
 - False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
 - Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
 - Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics. 

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Their stated goal is ridding ruqqus of nazis and other wrongthink (Ruqqus Correction Project). They keep a [list of badthink guilds](https://ruqqus.com/+AgainstChudGuilds/post/372n/how-to-detox-your-feed-a). They seize guilds with the sole purpose of destroying them, as we've seen recently with +HitlerWasRight and others. They coordinate offsite on discord. 

Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.

body:
That's not what I'm talking about:

* Admins let you get away with breaking (minor) rules like word filters and banned gifs

* Admins blatantly let you abuse being in channels you didn't earn access to

* Admins always favor you for guildmasters or or focus groups or whatever else

* Admins disable literally every restriction for you

* Admins give you more transparency and feedback on ruqqus than other users

* All the discord mods on github have write access to the codebase

* Admins let you pin your messages and get above everyone else (and for much more than mod stuff)

* Admins clearly show a favoritism for you and resolve to have only those users as mods, guildmasters, or anything else

* And yes, the admins were talking about a feature to let the "trusted users" administratively remove posts and admin distinguish, and a few other bits of admin-level authority.

Also *please* stop white knighting for the admins. You were super nice until 2 weeks ago, then you suddenly started barging in on peoples' conversations and shitting on them, especially when they say anything negative at all about the admins. Please don't follow cap's narcissistic attitude, it's not healthy.

post.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord
post.title: If you’re wondering, here’s what’s going on; Ruqqus Discord doesn’t like you.

> Am I? Like which? Why can't I advocate for laws that will improve the life of not just the majority of people but the righteous claimants to the nation?

Literally anyone who doesn't conform to your ideas about what people with certain biological features should be. The natural genetic lottery is already unfair enough, do we seriously need even more restrictions based on uncontrollable traits? You're basically saying you want to completely dictate every single person's life.

> only a single law is forever true and cannot be argued - might is right.

You child of Satan, brood of vipers! Are you so filled with pride that you are always right about everything? Do you not realize that this principle, which has been the prevailing view among the world since the beginning of time, is responsible for almost everything bad that people have done? All those brutal regimes, all those evil people, all had zero regard for other people and became convinced that they had the right to do whatever they want and rule over everyone however they please. You make yourself, a foolish person, into a god, and not a just one, but a brutal, selfish one. This principle is merely an excuse to try and justify your evil intentions.

> I think white genocide is magnitudes worse than tyrannical

White genocide requires laws and action, therefore it could not happen with inaction

> what do you propose to do to return white countries to at least 90% white majority?

What concern is it of yours what portion of people are of a certain skin color?

> Be careful when meeting your heroes, usually they're quite underwhelming.

Well that's just based on my real life and online life vs their online contributions only, so the chances of that are extremely slim.

>because you're advocating tons of tyrannical laws

Am I? Like which? Why can't I advocate for laws that will improve the life of not just the majority of people but the righteous claimants to the nation? You must remember that all laws are a larp, only a single law is forever true and cannot be argued - might is right. Unfortunately for you, your de-facto power holders understand this, you don't. 

The alternative to inaction is worse. I think white genocide is magnitudes worse than tyrannical, what do you propose to do to return white countries to at least 90% white majority? You really think ANY laws can fix that?

Be careful when meeting your heroes, usually they're quite underwhelming.

post.body:
It's undeniable that the central tenets of the (US) conservatives used to be small, limited government, states rights, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, etc. With a few exceptions (such as the war on drugs and the death penalty), conservatives were basically a more moderate version of libertarian, and there was a lot of spillover from one to the other.

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?
post.body_html:
It's undeniable that the central tenets of the (US) conservatives used to be small, limited government, states rights, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, etc. With a few exceptions (such as the war on drugs and the death penalty), conservatives were basically a more moderate version of libertarian, and there was a lot of spillover from one to the other.

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?
post.title: Conservatives, why have you forsaken libertarianism in the past few years?

body: Actually no, history has shown that the majority view is often not the correct one, which is why direct democracy and mob rule doesn't work too well. The reason is that most people are sheepish, idolizing power structures and hierarchies and conforming to whatever the elites tell them; it's nature, it gives them a sense of pride and community, and it's how tribal animals cooperate on a primal level (which is why it's so hard to not jump on the bandwagon and go against what's popular). But we know how trustworthy networks of elites are, power corrupts.

body:
And usually 95% of the population is like that. Until 200 years ago almost everyone considered slavery to be completely fine.

In this case, I gave an objective reason why it's an unethical practice: Pinning or otherwise distinguishing something that is not related to moderation is just a cheating mechanism so you can unfairly promote your thoughts above everyone elses'. It doesn't matter if everyone else does it or if you think that's okay or not, that's the way it is. It is a *fact* that you are using it for the purpose of evading the standard voting system and immediately giving yourself the first word. It's extremely tempting to abuse such things and give yourself an advantage, and that's why I think such few people make good mods, or any other type of ruler--you have to be *radically* dedicated to your principles and dealing fairly, or else corruption will surely result. Most people just don't worry about that sort of stuff (unless they are the victim of it), so that's why those who are tend to be a little nuts; but you can almost always trust them to be fair. Ideally though, the centralized power structure would be dismantled entirely.

parent.body: You're debating a strawman here. I did not say majority views are usually correct. I said widely accepted notions are usually correct. 51% is a majority accepted in any democracy. 51% is **not** enough to be a "widely accepted phenomenon". If you want to make a comparison to democracy, that which I define as "widely accepted" is that which is accepted by both left and right, let's say at least 80% of the population - and, like I said, it doesn't mean it's automatically right, it's just likely to be. This was evident by my usage of "it's about _all_ the people doing it". A simple 51% majority is nowhere near "all".

body:
> Do you want civilisation to continue or not? Because ultimately, that's the price of your decision.

No, it was wicked from the beginning, started by people who thought they knew everything and gave themselves excuses to take advantage of other for selfish gain, all being fooled by their insane level of pride and that fallen angel.

> You are bound by your uncontrollable traits, they were given to you by the Universe and you better learn to accept them. You can't control gravity, you're not complaining about being unable to jump 15 feet up, this is no different. Women and men are demonstrably different and therefore need different treatment.

So before you were arguing that my experiences were only exceptions, but now you're saying there are no exceptions?

> I wasn't the one who made the rules. If your planet is getting blasted by a solar flare - it's getting blasted by a solar flare and you're not arguing it. If it's going to be vored by a black hole - it's going to be vored by a violent, mighty black hole and you're not arguing it. It's the laws of the Universe and you and me obey them. The only way you could prevent those two scenarios is by applying a terrific amount of energy (violence) in a constructive way

This is a justification of self-defense only. But what you said was "might is right".

> and if the only way to consolidate that amount of energy in a constructive beam is to restrict women's freedoms then I'm doing it.

Where are you getting these crazy ideas from? Do you think women and black people are magical disaster magnets?

> Dramatise less, fren, your emotions are weighing down on your practical thinking, Your mind seems thoroughly jewed and I'm saying this because you're speaking in Hollywood cliches.

Hollywood actually tries to romanticize those savage civilizations, such as the Renaissance, Ancient Rome, Greece, and Egypt, for supporting humanist worldviews. And you're probably right that my mind is jewed, because I worship one who will end all of this very soon.

> Shut down your biases for a second and watch through [this](https://www.bitchute.com/video/jpIkxc7YnzZa/) and tell me - was this man evil?

It would be silly for a person with an evil agenda to announce it loudly and expect to gain support. Rather, the successful villains are those that are the best at deceiving others, fooling them into letting them do whatever it is they want to do. So no way Hitler is going to publicly announce his plans to commit genocide and dictate everyone's lives and take over the world; he's going to try and maintain a good image so people unwittingly submit to him.

> There aren't any laws that specifically target whites, so how come white genocide happens?

I'm not aware of any white genocide at the current moment, just a bunch of woke SJWs wishing for it.

> My homeland is to remain my homeland and my extended family is having my skin colour and all the billions of traits that come with it.

Again, I already debunked your claim that every single trait is determined by skin color and sex.

> "Skin color" is a dishonest jewish simplification and you better stop using it if you want to remain intellectually honest.

What does this even have to do with jews?

> By "meeting" I mean learning more of them, you don't have to meet one personally to find out they're not really what you pictured them as.

Actually these are mostly people I do know personally.

So no way Hitler is going to publicly announce his plans to commit genocide and dictate everyone's lives and take over the world; he's going to try and maintain a good image so people unwittingly submit to him.

There aren't any laws that specifically target whites, so how come white genocide happens?

I'm not aware of any white genocide at the current moment, just a bunch of woke SJWs wishing for it.

My homeland is to remain my homeland and my extended family is having my skin colour and all the billions of traits that come with it.

Again, I already debunked your claim that every single trait is determined by skin color and sex.

"Skin color" is a dishonest jewish simplification and you better stop using it if you want to remain intellectually honest.

What does this even have to do with jews?

By "meeting" I mean learning more of them, you don't have to meet one personally to find out they're not really what you pictured them as.

Actually these are mostly people I do know personally.

>The natural genetic lottery is already unfair enough, do we seriously need even more restrictions based on uncontrollable traits?

Do you want civilisation to continue or not? Because ultimately, that's the price of your decision. You are bound by your uncontrollable traits, they were given to you by the Universe and you better learn to accept them. You can't control gravity, you're not complaining about being unable to jump 15 feet up, this is no different. Women and men are demonstrably different and therefore need different treatment.

>Do you not realize that this principle, which has been the prevailing view among the world since the beginning of time, is responsible for almost everything bad that people have done?

I wasn't the one who made the rules. If your planet is getting blasted by a solar flare - it's getting blasted by a solar flare and you're not arguing it. If it's going to be vored by a black hole - it's going to be vored by a violent, mighty black hole and you're not arguing it. It's the laws of the Universe and you and me obey them. The only way you could prevent those two scenarios is by applying a terrific amount of energy (violence) in a constructive way and if the only way to consolidate that amount of energy in a constructive beam is to restrict women's freedoms then I'm doing it.

>All those brutal regimes, all those evil people, all had zero regard for other people and became convinced that they had the right to do whatever they want and rule over everyone however they please. You make yourself, a foolish person, into a god, and not a just one, but a brutal, selfish one. This principle is merely an excuse to try and justify your evil intentions.

Dramatise less, fren, your emotions are weighing down on your practical thinking, Your mind seems thoroughly jewed and I'm saying this because you're speaking in Hollywood cliches. Shut down your biases for a second and watch through [this](https://www.bitchute.com/video/jpIkxc7YnzZa/) and tell me - was this man evil? 

>White genocide requires laws and action, therefore it could not happen with inaction

There aren't any laws that specifically target whites, so how come white genocide happens? Real power finds its ways and laws are, as I mentioned, a contract between the mighty and the numerous (because there is power in numbers). What is stopping either side from breaking the contract? You already know the answer.

post.body:
It's undeniable that the central tenets of the (US) conservatives used to be small, limited government, states rights, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, etc. With a few exceptions (such as the war on drugs and the death penalty), conservatives were basically a more moderate version of libertarian, and there was a lot of spillover from one to the other.

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?
post.title: Conservatives, why have you forsaken libertarianism in the past few years?
